publicationstmt.publisher: Published by and available from the William Blake Archive, http://www.blakearchive.org

availability.p: ©2008 Morris Eaves, Robert N. Essick, Joseph Viscomi.

projectdesc.p: These collection lists were prepared for the William Blake Archive.

p.hi: None of the works in these collection lists is held at the offices of the William Blake Archive. Please contact the owning institution if you desire further information or wish to make arrangements to view any works.

figure.teiform: Exterior of Library of Congress Thomas Jefferson Building

div1.head: Catalog Information
div1.p: Catalog References are by entry number to The Lessing J. Rosenwald Collection: A Catalog of the Gifts of Lessing J. Rosenwald to the Library of Congress, 1943-1975 (Washington, D.C.: Library of Congress, 1977).

div2.head: Designed by Blake and Engraved by Other Engravers

Brown, John. The Elements of Medicine. 1795. Plate only.Catalog no. 1838.19
Chaucer, Geoffrey. The Poetical Works. From Bell's Edition of the Poets of Great Britain. 1782. Plate only.Catalog no. 1838.6

The Monthly Magazine and British Register. 1798. Plate only.Catalog no. 1838.21
The Novelist's Magazine, Vol. 8. 1782. Catalog no. 1838.5

div2.head: Pencil Sketches
div2.bibl: Sketch for the Frontispiece to 'The Eagle' (recto); Two Sketches for a Frontispiece (verso). The recto is a preliminary drawing for William Hayley, Designs to a Series of Ballads (1802), plate 6.Catalog no. 1821
Sketches for Rees's Cyclopaedia. Preliminary drawings on one sheet for plates 1 and 4.Catalog no. 1838.30
A Woman with Snaky Locks (recto); Father and Mother, I Return (verso). Perhaps for The Gates of Paradise.Catalog No. 1840 add. a

div2.head: Monochrome Wash Drawings
div2.bibl: Drawing of William Cowper after Romney. Preliminary drawing for William Hayley, Life of William Cowper (1803-04), plate 1.Catalog no. 1823

Ten Sketches for Mary Wollstonecraft's 'Original Stories'. Preliminary drawings for the plates in Mary Wollstonecraft, Original Stories from Real Life (1791), with 4 designs not engraved.Catalog no. 1818
